author: wadalliance
title: Wada Preserving Culture: NFT -> DAO
description: Los servicios digitales para la propiedad intelectual no están disponibles para las comunidades indígenas, lo que las excluye de una representación justa y legal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I know how important decentralised communities and governance processes are for democratic and economic empowerment. DAOs are a powerful tool in this respect. I want to bring in my personal knowledge and experience on various governance models into action by assessing proposals in this challenge. The proposal adresses a very real problem, the disenfranchisement and cultural appropriation that is happening to indigenous communities. The solution they provide links together Blockchain, intellectual Property, NFTs and DAOS and  will not only be beneficial for the Cardano ecosystem, but also will help people getting a fair share of their IP in a way that is much more transparent than what is currently the state of business. It will connect people and give them a huge perspective, such it can be said to have a big impact. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since WADA is a great multiplicator and keeps establishing,  it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
WADA are a really active and established part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt they will be able to successfully implement this proposal. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large group as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Well-defined, detailed metrics and an auditable roadmap are presented that define the success of the proposal. A clear, understandable problem description is accompanied by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0: I've done a bit of research on the Wanda team when I purchased my Afrixx CNFT. I love the ambition and capability the team poses and they have effectively addressed how they plan. To address the challenge in this proposal. I would like to see them receive funding and continue their great work in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the Wada team and associates have what it takes to successfully implement this proposal. The team strikes me to be highly skilled and organized with great intent.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the information provided with regards to the cost associated with this endeavor was presented in a clear manner. I trust with the teams experience that they are well aware of the cost associated with what they set out to do and their breakdown shows that some research was done with regards to this endeavor. Once the project begins the Wada team seems to have placed the necessary auditing mechanisms in place for continued transparent operation and preservation of   African culture, heritage, artifacts etc via the Cardano blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0: I would advise the team to rework the problem statement and solution to address the challenge brief. The challenge brief outlines success as creating solutions to better manage a DAO on Cardano. The problem statement references digital services for intellectual property and the team proposes a solution to create NFTs for Property rights, in my opinion the proposal should be filled under Miscellaneous Challenge. I feel the proposal does not align with the challenge brief.
f6_assessments.q1: The team referenced previous successful project that got funded, it would be great for the team to present the results from the funded proposal to increase trust, prove legitimacy and demonstrate success. The detailed plan presented is actually a problem statement and solution reworked, the actual plan was not presented. The proposal identified one risk and proposed a mitigation in one sentence, it would be great if the team could expand on the risks assessment and mitigation section. The team (WADA) has more than 10 proposals entered for fund 7, if all are successful I am worried that the team will be over loaded and not be able to successfully execute.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a high level budget and simple roadmap. The team identified Key metrics but did not assign measurables to it, I advice the team to add measurables (set goals) to the key metrics example: write 5 research reports, have 2000 attendees etc. I would like to see the team expand the budget (beyond simple line entries) and roadmap (create more milestones), furthermore, I would like to see the team connect the budget, roadmap and KPIs, in this way the team can track spending over time vs. performance. As the project stands at the moment, I believe it will be challenging to audit.

solution: Crear un modelo basado en NFT para los derechos de Propiedad Intelectual que se integrará en WadaDAO Preservando la Cultura en Cardano Blockchain.
experience: Propuesta financiada por el Fondo 6 "Preservar la cultura", el equipo de Wada y sus socios trabajan en la creación de DAOs, desarrolladores y asesoramiento legal disponibles.
